title: Best of Athens
text: I was a tiny bit disappointed in the food we had in Athens - nothing really struck me as that one memorable meal. Then, on our last meal in Greece, we found Rosalia. This place was so good. The food was great and the prices were very reasonable. It is a short walk from the National Archeological Museum, which will take you through an... interesting... neighborhood. No one gave us any trouble, the food is worth it.

title: Something different - so much fun
text: I am not sure I learned much about cooking, but it was a really memorable experience. The process of working together to prepare a meal got people talking and interacting. By the time we sat down to eat the dinner conversation flowed naturally. Sophia (our teacher) really had a knack for getting people involved, then letting interactions develope naturally. This is not your same old tour, I really recommend you give it a try.

title: Experience the rest of Athens
text: Our guide Georgia, was fantastic. She took us away from the tourist mainstays, for a look at how the city appears to Athenians. She was energetic and clearly passionate about her city. We saw (and tasted) things we would have otherwise missed. Time is valuable on a vacation, but this tour is definitely worth the half day.

title: A nice but unremarkable restaurant
text: The food was good and the servers were friendly, but it was noisy. Overall, it is a fair choice if you are near Syntagma Square, but not worth a trip from some other area.

title: Must see
text: I don't know if it is really necessary to write this review. I can't imagine anyone travelling to Athens and not seeing the Acropolis, but if you are considering skipping it - don't. It is more impressive than any picture can convey and the view of the city is amazing. Get a good guide who can explain what you are looking at.

title: Best castle ever
text: In all fairness, I have only been in a half dozen castles so I am probably not qualified to present the “Best Castle Ever” award. Blackness is, however, everything I thought of castles as a child. It has towers, a draw bridge, battlements, a dungeon and is just generally cool. Pay to go inside and wander around.

title: Lunch deal was amazing
text: This place was recommended by the concierge, so I hadn’t checked the reviews on trip advisor before eating there. The meal was fantastic. When I found it here to write this review I was surprised to se it ranked 84th - I thought it would have been much higher. I read through the bad reviews and they did not match our experience at all. Servers were friendly and the food was delicious. Definitely try this place for lunch (before 4:00) since the prices are lower but the portions are still large. The venison pie is a must try and the muscles are worth the £1 up charge.

title: Learn a lot in a short time
text:
I really liked this place. There is not a lot of depth to the information given; but, it is a great overview. It gives you a little bit of context to think about the economy, history and people of Iceland as you see the country. Every video was well made.

Of course, as mentioned by so many others, there is free coffee.

title: Great seafood
text: The food here was really top notch. The flavor and presentation were both impressive. The serving size wasn’t huge, but was reasonable and the price seemed completely fair. It is hard for me to comment on service. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, but we were eating at an odd time and were one of two tables - not a real test.

title: A lot of small disappointments
text:
There was no one thing I can point to on why I would not return this hotel. The room was clean and the staff was reasonably friendly. Unfortunately, there were multiple things that all added up to an unpleasant experience so I will just list the main ones:

-the room had no fan and the neighborhood is way too loud all night to open a window
-the mattress was very hard and uncomfortable
-the vent in the bathroom was stuck shut and I had to prop it open with a Q-tip (I hoped that would circulate some air, but it didn’t help.)
-There is no safe to store valuables in the room.
-since there was no safe, we left the “do not disturb” sign out all day but the cleaners entered anyway and did their room service (nothing was stolen or gone through, but still that was not ok.)
-by 7:00 there was enough loud noises to wake us up one day (the other day was quieter, so this could have been singular incident.)

I feel like this hotel made a half-hearted effort to be higher end. The facade and lobby are nice enough, but once you enter the elevators it feels a lot mor budget.

title: This is what a hotel should be
text: If you check my other reviews you will see I don’t give hotels 5 stars very often, but this one earned it. I won’t waste time listing everything I liked about this hotel, just know they hit all the high notes on room, service, amenities, and accessibility. If I am ever in Dublin again, this is the hotel I will stay at.

title: Great for self-guided tour
text: This is a fantastic museum. It gives a walkthrough of Irish history with plenty of placards and videos to put everything into context. We had only planned an hour here, but ended up doubling that. Even then we only left because we had a scheduled tour. If you love history this is a half day attraction as you read and inspect all the exhibits. Even if you are not that interested in history, the bog-mummies alone are worth the time.

title: Just like Italy
text: I try to stick to local cuisine when traveling (why come to Ireland to eat Italian food?), but we made an exception based for Emiliano’s based on reviews. I am glad we did. The food, the atmosphere, everything reminded me how much I loved eating in Italy. My cod was really good, but my wife’s beef linguini was fantastic.

title: Interesting tour
text: Seeing how Waterford Crystal pieces are made was fun. The tour takes less than an hour and is worth the time.
place: House of Waterford Crystal Guided Factory Tour

title: A short tour but I learned a lot
text: The tour is about an hour. I would strongly recommend taking it instead of just wondering through on your own. Our guide was great, he was engaging and knowledgeable. The vestments were the highlight. It is amazing they survived.

title: OK, but not quite must see
text: This was an interesting tour, but if you must skip something don’t feel too bad about not seeing this.

title: Small room but very nice
text: The small room didn’t bother me, but might matter to some. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The location was great - the neighborhood is walkable with plenty of pubs and restaurants. You will have to pay to park. There are two garages, one is cheap but may not be appropriate for large vehicles while the other is quite expensive. I would recommend contacting the hotel before your arrival for parking instructions.

title: Meh, just a pub
text: The food was mediocre and the service was lackluster. To be fair they did have a “help wanted” sign in the window and an extra server or two might have helped on that side of things. There was nothing wrong with the food, but neither was it memorable. I had a cod and scampi gratin, really the only flavor it had was the lemon juice and salt that I added. The potatoes were plain and the vegetables tasted straight out of the freezer isle. My wife said the fish and chips were typical. I can’t help but think there might be better seafood in a fishing town.

title: Try this, you’ll be glad you did
text: It is not surprising there so many awards decorating the walls of this establishment - the food really is that good. Appetizer through desert, our meal was outstanding. The service was exemplary and prices were reasonable. If you are in Waterford, you really should try this.

title: The restoration makes this castle interesting
text: There are a lot of castles in Ireland; however this one has been restored to show its Victorian state. It gives a sense of what it would have been like to live at that time. I am not certain I would make a trip from Dublin just to see it, but if you are in the area it is worth the stop.

title: Much more than expected
text: When we decided to travel to Ireland it was for castles and scenic countryside. I never thought it would be a “food trip”, but wow! When I saw the prices (around €15 per entree) I assumed a mid-range quality; however, this place was better than a lot of more expensive restaurants is Italy. The food and the atmosphere were great and our server, Leah, hit the sweet-spot between friendly and non-intrusive.

title: Cathedral was impressive; but the cemetery was the attraction
text: It is free to enter the grounds and doesn’t take long to see. If you are in the area, there is no reason not to stop and look. There are placards with a bit of history on the crypts and graves that really give a sense of how old this place is. The area around is also very walkable, with plenty of coffe shops and pubs.

title: Something different
text: I had never tried Salvadoran food, so I did not know what to expect. The pupusas were very good and the prices were fair. The food was flavorful without being too spicy. The corn tamale was also worth trying.

title: I don’t understand the hype
text: There is nothing wrong with Sam’s, but there is nothing special either. There is a wide selection and the food is better than Denny’s (a very low bar to clear), but it is still just a mediocre diner. People seem to love it though.

title: Fun 50s atmosphere, but just a diner
text: I like the 1950s style, but the food is nothing special and the service is hit or miss. If you want breakfast at 7pm and this is the closest place it is OK; but definitely not worth a trip across town.

title: A nice diner with reasonable prices
text: Everything here is exactly what I would expect out of a diner. The food, service and prices are all good. Nothing here was exceptional, but it is still worth a try.

title: Very nice, but close to I-90
text:
This was a great hotel. Very clean, staff was great and the room was comfortable. My only concern was how close it was to the interstate. Saturday morning traffic started to pick up around 7am and the noise woke me up. I think being on the other side of the hall (window away from traffic) would have made a big difference.

Note: it is a bit tricky to figure out how to access the parking lot from East bound I-90, use GPS or Google Maps.

title: So-so City in a great area
text: Downtown Spokane has a kind of older, dirt vibe (not including Riverfront Park, which is nice.) It is not a of destination so much as a service point for people visiting the really beautiful area around Spokane.

title: An interesting change of pace
text: I wasn’t sure what to expect, but it was good. Similar to Greek food, but with some very distinct flavors. It was not too spicy. Definitely try the sambas.

title: Incredible museum
text: We didn’t shoot while we were there, but the range looked ok. The real treasure is the museum. I could have spent days there just looking at the collection and listening to the guides talk.

title: Good location and price
text: The room was a bit small, but that seemed true of everywhere we stayed in Italy. Other than that it was a nice hotel. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and the location was pretty good. You can walk to Vatican City (it is a ways, but doable), there are a few good restaurants around and the bus stop is very close. There is a really nice garden area to sit and plan the day.

title: Must eat here
text: We were only in Italy for a week (Rome, Florence, Venice), but no other restaraunt compared to this one. The food, service and atmosphere were top notch. The prices were reasonable for what it was (I have certainly paid more for less here in Denver.) If you you are in Florence you really owe it to yourself to eat here. It's small, so reservations may be in order.

title: Highlight of Rome
text:
My parents skipped the tour of the Sistine Chapel and St. Peters Basilica when they went to Rome and spent decades regretting it. The Colosseum and Forum are good to see, but this is amazing, don't miss it.

Note: Skip-the-line tours are completely worth the money! We went in the off season and the line to get in was around the block. I would hate to see it in peak season.

title: Impressive in person
text: Even if you have seen the pictures, it is so much more in person. You definitely want to book a skip-the-line tour for this and St. Peter's Basilica if you are going to be in Rome.

title: Good tour, but not must-see
text:
If you have the time while in Florence, this is a good trip to take; however, with travel time it will pretty much use up an entire day. If you are only going to be there for a couple of days and need to cut things out of your itinerary, don't feel too bad about missing out on this. The architecture is impressive, but really this boils down to a famous photo-op.

If you do go here are a couple of thoughts:
1) Get your tickets to climb the tower in advance. Entrance to the tower is limited and you may not be able to get them there.
2) Get instructions on how to get to the departure point before you go. It is not obvious and it would be easy to miss a bus.
place: Pisa and the Leaning Tower Afternoon Tour from Florence

title: A good place to start
text: We only spent one day in Venice, so I am glad we booked this tour. It gave a nice overview of the city for a very low cost. Our guide was knowledgeable and helped us navigate the maze of streets (Google maps cannot be trusted in Venice.) I would recommend booking an early tour, so the streets are less crowded.
place: Venice Sightseeing Walking Tour with a Local Guide

title: Best Pizza ever
text: Big slices, reasonable prices and oh so delicious. This tiny pizzeria has no seating, but is definitely the place to go for lunch.

title: Very good for longer stays
text:
This place was nice. You could tell it was getting a bit older, new paint and carpet would have helped our unit a lot; however, it was clean and the staff was friendly. The kitchen and washer/dryer are a big plus for reducing meal cost and luggage if you are going to be on the island for more than a few days. There really isn't much of a beach on the property and nothing is within walking distance, so you need to rent a car, but that is something you probably want to do on the big island anyway. Parking was adequate for us, but I don't know what it would be like during peak tourist seasons.

Pros: price was fair, full kitchen with all appliances, washer/dryer, clean, short drive to Kailua

Cons: nothing within walking distance, no common area amenities beyond an average pool (no gym etc)

title: Good Burgers and fair prices
text: The food is great here and it is cheaper than Outback, Red Robin, or anything like that. It is kind of a college hangout, so it can get crowded and noisy (especially on the weekends), and that can lead to rushed service. It is still worth checking out.

title: Great value
text: The food is really good, and the prices are lower than comparable restaurants. The "red sauce" is not good (tastes like it is right out of a can), but the "Colorado sauce" really good. Deserts are huge, so consider sharing.

title: Christams light show was ok
text: I have not been to the gardens in the summer, but we went to see the Christmas lights. It was nice, but not spectacular. There were a few neat parts, but mostly just a lot of lights. We did not buy the holo-glasses that supposedly make you see shapes in the lights. Overall if you are bored, it is something to do but not a bucket-list item.

title: It's OK, but with a Macaroni Grill near by why settle?
text: The food, service and price were all acceptable; but Macaroni Grill is so much better and only a couple of miles north on Abilene St.

title: Average art museum (did not visit Modern Art Museum)
text: I only visited the the older part of the Museum, but it was exactly what I would expect out of a larger museum (nothing more, nothing less). I have heard the Modern Art Museum is very nice, but I did not have time to see both.

title: Nice shop, great instructor
text: My wife and I are novice divers that wanted to take a refresher course before getting back in to it. We tried Ocean First on a recommendation from a friend. I was a little uncertain, since they are SSI (as opposed to PADI), but figured for a really basic refresher they would be about the same. I was very impressed with our instructor (Mark). He really did a great job of thoroughly covering the basics in a timely fashion, so we had plenty of pool time. Mark was very patient and I would recommend him for anyone who feels a bit uncertain about diving.

title: Nice hike, but no dogs
text: It is an interesting hike, but dogs are not allowed (for good reason). The fee is a bit high for what it is ($4.00), and there are plenty of free hikes in the area.

title: So good, so cheap.
text: Nothing special about this place except for good food and good service. The price is very reasonable, which is especially nice considering Silverthorne is a mountain town. This is a perfect place to stop for breakfast if you are heading west out of denver and want to beat morning traffic.

title: Not as good as it looked on the Web-site
text:
The Web-site made this place look great for the low price, but be aware there is no free wi-fi and no free continental breakfast. Paying for those things would bring the price up to what you would pay for a nicer hotel. The lobby was nice, the room was ok and other common areas were acceptable. The friendly and helpful staff were the one bright point.

Overall, if the location is perfect for you then don't be afraid to stay here; otherwise there are probably better deals.

title: upscale
text: A very nice hotel, definately geared towards high-end business travelers. It is flashy and expensive, while the places to eat on property are very limited. It is in a very high traffice area, so driving during rush-hour is no fun. My final opinion is that it is nice, but Orlando has other nice places that are cheaper.

title: best Disney for adults
text: Interesting, but it only takes 1/2 day to see everything.

title: So-so mix of zoo and amusement park
text: Not as good as most big zoos or amusement parks, Only a few animals and a few rides. The "back-stage" veternary clinic was interesting, but not worth going for.

title: A very nice steak house
text: The steak was amazing, the shrimp were fantastic and the prices were fair. The only disappointing part was the vegitables - an over-cooked mix of frozen, think public school cafeteria.

title: Better than Disney
text: This was really the best theme park we visited. Far more interesting than anything at Disney World. Harry Potter World was nicely done (even my fan-girl wife approved) and there were plenty of rides. The only downside was a lack of shows and performers, but there was still plenty to do.

title: I wish I could give this 6 stars
text: I have seen the Blue Man Group here and in Vegas. The show is simply amazing. It is funny and family friendly. I strongly recommend you see them at least once, and Orlando has a very nice theater for them.

title: Best part of any theme park
text: They did such a great job with this, it was better than anything else I saw in Universal or Disney World. It really captured the spirit of the books/movies.
place: The Wizarding World of Harry Potter

title: Great place for longer stay with family
text: The property was beautiful, the suite was huge and very clean, it had a kitchen and there were free laundry rooms. It would be a great place to spend a week. There was lake with a beach, 2 pools, golf, mini-golf, and all that space. Not as fancy as the Grand Cypress, but in my opinion a better value.
place: Holiday Inn Club Vacations At Orange Lake Resort

title: Nice but nothing special
text: It was a nice hotel, but for the price it was not that great. I know Boca Raton is an expensive area, but this hotel does not justify the price tag. There was nothing wrong with it, but it was not terribly impressive. Everything was acceptable.

title: Nothing fancy, just good food and fair price
text: Not a fancy resturaunt, but the food was good. It is a nice place to eat lunch.
place: Hurricane Alley Raw Bar and Restaurant

title: What you would expect from Holiday Inn
text: The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. It is very easy to get to from the Interstate. There was nothing special about this, it is similar to other Holiday Inns I have stayed in (meaning nice but slightly on the expensive side).
place: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites - Ocala Conference Center

title: Nice hotel
text: I had never stayed in a Country Inn before, but was pleased. The lobby was nice. The hallway on our floor smelled strange (almost like strong body odor), but the room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly. The location was ok, there was not much in the immediate area. Overall good, but not great.
place: Country Inn & Suites By Radisson, Gainesville

title: no frills, but clean
text: The room was tiny and the motel older, but it was very clean. The walls are pretty thin, I could hear the TV next door clearly. There was no one at the front desk when I went to check out, so I left my key on the table in the room and a note at the lobby entrance. I only stayed one night, I could see how the room might not be appropriate for a longer stay (due to the size). If I am ever in Herber City again, I will probably stay here due to the price.

title: Crater diving is only a novelty
text: The crater is OK for training dives and as a novelty, but not really worth it as a destination. There is not much to see. Even 1 medium size group of divers made it overly crowded. If you find yourself in Midway with nothing else to do, maybe. It cost over $20 just to be in the water for a couple of hours (that did not include any rental gear).

title: Nice hotel, pet friendly, reasonably priced
text: We always stay here when we go to Denver. It is clean, allows dogs at no additional charge (there may be a refundable deposit - I don't remember), and has a great location. It is a very short drive to a shopping center that has theaters, restaurants, bars and a Dave & Busters. It is a great weekend destination in itself. It is also easy to get to Flat Irons mall from here.

title: Joe's Jam - Best of Buck
text: I dove all around the North and West sides of Buck Island and this was my favorite dive. The fans and coral were awesome.

title: Outstanding diving and chartered cruises
text: The two dive/tour cruises we went on with Aqua Marine were the best two days of our trip to ST Thomas. They had a nice boat, good equipment and a great crew. It was a little more expensive than some places, but well worth the money. I would highly recommend them to anyone.
